meanings.def: a large crowd of people, especially one that may become violent or cause trouble
examples: The mob was/were preparing to storm the building.
mob rule (= a situation in which a mob has control, rather than people in authority)
the lawless days of mob rule and anarchy
An angry mob of demonstrators came charging around the corner.
He was greeted by a mob of well-wishers eager to shake his hand.
Let's get out of here before the mob gets out of control.

meanings.def: a group of people who are similar in some way
examples: All the usual mob were there.

meanings.def: the people involved in organized crime; the Mafia
a group of strong, often violent people employed to do something such as protect somebody

idioms.def: a group of strong, often violent people employed to do something such as protect somebody

meanings.def: if a crowd of birds or animals mob another bird or animal, they gather round it and attack it
examples: Adult birds come over to mob the predator while the chicks take cover.

meanings.def: if a person is mobbed by a crowd of people, the crowd gathers round them in order to see them and try and get their attention, sometimes in a slightly aggressive way
examples: be mobbed (by somebody) The star was mobbed by eager fans.
